unnormalised: The retail sector in India witnessed fluctuating trends this week, marked by a mix of online and offline sales performances. According to a report released on 16/07/2024, e-commerce giants like Flipkart and Amazon recorded a 15% increase in sales during their mid-year sales event, with mobile phones and electronics contributing to 60% of the total revenue. In comparison, brick-and-mortar stores experienced a more modest growth of 8% during the same period.
normalised: The retail sector in India witnessed fluctuating trends this week, marked by a mix of online and offline sales performances. According to a report released on sixteenth July two thousand and twenty four, e-commerce giants like F-l-i-p-k-a-r-t and A-m-a-z-o-n recorded a fifteen percent increase in sales during their mid-year sales event, with mobile phones and electronics contributing to sixty percent of the total revenue. In comparison, brick-and-mortar stores experienced a more modest growth of eight percent during the same period.

unnormalised: Analysts attribute the divergence to various factors, including aggressive online discounting and changing consumer preferences. The average transaction value online stood at Rs. 2500, whereas the average spend in physical stores hovered around Rs. 1800. The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has expressed concerns over the continued dominance of online retailers, citing unfair pricing practices that disadvantage small business owners. CAIT reported that approximately 30% of small retailers saw a dip of 20% in their sales this July compared to July last year.

The Confederation of All India Traders (C-A-I-T) has expressed concerns over the continued dominance of online retailers, citing unfair pricing practices that disadvantage small business owners. C-A-I-T reported that approximately thirty percent of small retailers saw a dip of twenty percent in their sales this July compared to July last year.

unnormalised: The festive season is expected to provide a significant boost to the retail sector, with Diwali and Dussehra anticipated to drive consumer spending. Projections estimate a 25% surge in overall retail sales during the Oct-Nov period. However, rising inflation, currently at 6.5%, poses a challenge. Consumers are becoming more price-sensitive, leading to increased demand for budget-friendly options.

unnormalised: Major retailers are adapting to the changing landscape by strengthening their online presence and offering omnichannel experiences. Companies like Reliance Retail are investing heavily in digital infrastructure and supply chain management to cater to both online and offline customers. They opened 5 new stores in Mumbai last week. These stores average a footprint of 1200 sq ft.

unnormalised: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is closely monitoring the retail inflation rate and its impact on consumer spending. Measures to control inflation are expected to be implemented in the coming months to maintain market stability. Overall, the Indian retail sector presents a mixed picture, characterized by opportunities and challenges, demanding adaptability and strategic planning from businesses to thrive.
